website_summaries.verdict: The New Balance 1540 v2 is a motion control road running shoe that offers incredible comfort. Although there were negative feedback about the price, limited colors and weight, the 1540 v2 is still a worthy investment. It has much improved design, cushioning, and durability that will allow runners to pound their way to their goals.
pros: Many runners took note that the New Balance 1540 v2 is well ventilated
This shoe provides improved arch support, as mentioned in some reviews
It has blown rubber outsole for added durability in high wear areas
The upper construction of the shoe is highly breathable and runners liked how comfortable this shoe felt
It has a roomy toe box that made most wide-footed runners happy
cons: For some runners, this shoe is slightly expensive

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I've worn New Balance for years, this is the first pair I've worn that fell apart after a couple months of wear. Leather coming off from the nylon and a hole in the back of the shoe. Will never buy these online again.
customer_reviews.author: William B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for spinal pain, knee arthritis and foot aches
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shoe for people with joint and spinal pain, arthritis. I bought $50 New Balance shoes before and they were great. A concerned family member bought me a pair of these for $150 and they were superior for offsetting pain and soreness. Are they worth $150? Maybe. They do feel better than the others, and I can go further with these 1500 series than my previous New Balance running/walking shoes in the 400 series. I did just fine with several (5) pairs of New Balance 400 series at $59 each in one year (every 2 months wearing out at 5 miles/day walking). These are supposed to last longer, so we'll see. They are immediately more comfortable than the previous models.
customer_reviews.author: Bill T

customer_reviews.title: Best New Balance ever! Comfortable and fits well!!️
customer_reviews.text: Most comfortable New Balance running shoes ever. The M1540V2 fit better than the M990v3 I normally order. The 6E size makes the difference for I have wide feet. Shoes are well constructed with quality materials. Best of all the are made in USA !!️Will buy again and highly recommend. 👍 Update: wore these M1540V2 on travel trip on long plane ride, did lots of walking thru airports and at destination . The comfort of these gems reduced my arthritis knee pain. The 11 6EEEEEE width size was a perfect fit. Highly recommend the well constructed and desired shoes!!️
customer_reviews.author: T. S. C. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !
customer_reviews.text: I walk on the outside edge of my feet. I have to wear a corrective orthotic. The combination of this shoe and my inserts I am able to make it throughs a day pain free. The built in roll bar really is the key. I have cut down on my wear and tear on my feet as well as my shoes. The roll bar helps extend the length of time I am able to keep wearing them without having to repurchase new ones as often. It also helps with keeping my feet flat.
customer_reviews.author: JW tucson

customer_reviews.title: Arch support that is as solid as a brick was so painful. If you need that type of thing
customer_reviews.text: 11.5 4E size, so shoes are hard to find. I bought these because they seemed to be top of the line running shoes. I had to switch back to my old ones after half a mile. Arch support that is as solid as a brick was so painful. If you need that type of thing, then these are for you, but I couldn't take it.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for wide sizes.
customer_reviews.text: I require a 6E width for shoes, which is nearly impossible to find. I have had a few pairs of New Balance shoes, as they are the only brand that I have found that makes shoes that truly fit me well. I highly recommend these shoes for anyone who has feet that are more like flippers, like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Kurtis Lind

customer_reviews.title: #1 New Balance shoe for the daily walker
customer_reviews.text: The 1540 is an outstanding shoe; shadowing all prior models. The price is getting out of hand, but what would you expect a consumer to say? Good news is that there are several vendors that unloaded their product at end of year and the standard price was sliced. Hope that New Balance continues to make a very good shoe with their continued roll bar construction for over pronators...but also consider price as the daily consumers (and long standing consumers) must consider that, especially when they walk 5 miles per day and the shoes ware out in just over 3 months!?*
customer_reviews.author: benduck

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought this model about three years ago at a sporting goods store on the recommendation of the sales person. This was my third pair. I love this shoe. It is probably the best shoe I have ever had on my feet. I can't run any more, but I walk about five miles a day. They always feel good, even at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Bill

customer_reviews.title: Great for Plantar Facitiis but...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes for Plantar Fascistic but I had to buy a New Balance arch support great for this problem. The inserts that came with the shoes is terrible... but easily pulled out and replaced. This is my second pair... they helped me to walk again. Shoes arrived in a beat up almost deflated box... seems it has been around the country more than once. Bottoms appear to have been worn before..... perhaps part of this 'try it before you buy it.' They did smell new. I think I will not buy these shoes from Amazon in the future. These are great shoes for Plantar fascistic but when I pay for NEW shoes... I expect to get NEW SHOES. .
customer_reviews.author: RobertW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Sneakers
customer_reviews.text: These are a men’s size 9 narrow! I wear them! They are more unisex than just for men. I have problems with my feet and sometimes they swell but in these shoes nothing hurts! I wear them to the gym, on walks and hikes! They are fantastic sneakers/shoes. I love this color combo but own many of the black pairs, as well. They are long lasting and even wear them in the rain and they stand up fine. I have worn hundreds of sneakers in my lifetime but nothing like these awesome shoes. Extremely comfortable, durable and very long lasting. You will not be disappointed in New Balance! Trust me on that!!
customer_reviews.author: Berna

customer_reviews.title: The Best Shoes I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: In December 2018, I rolled my ankle on a walk and suffered a minor fracture of my fifth metatarsal. After several weeks in an aircast, my orthopedic surgeon recommended these shoes to prevent future ankle rolls. These shoes provide excellent support for the foot, for a wide variety of street activities. They're great for walking and bicycling, and I could run in them in a pinch (they're too heavy for use as runner's shoes, however). And yes, they have saved me from rolled ankles at least three times.
customer_reviews.author: nunya

customer_reviews.title: FAVORITE WORK SHOE!
customer_reviews.text: My husband has been wearing this shoe for the past few years at work. He gets a new pair every 6 months because these are the only shoes that keep his feet comfortable and his back pain-free during his long and busy workday. He tracks his steps daily and he ranges from 10,000-15,000 steps a day walking and standing on concrete OR floors. He, also, climbs multiple sets of stairs every day as he makes his clinical rounds. He always has an extra pair available because he wears a size13 which are sometimes difficult to find.
customer_reviews.author: hillcroft

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the intense block-style "Roll Bar" arch support
customer_reviews.text: I love New Balance sneakers. This is my second attempt at NB sneakers with the Roll Bar as a very flat-footed, over-pronating buffalo runner. I again find them too cumbersome to run in. I can't tell if it's just they're heavy or feel too boxy. My running has not improved from training since switching to these 6 months ago. I think I need to choose my next NB sneakers that have the over-pronating arch support, but not the Roll Bar and use NB's Motion Control 3210 insoles instead. The sneakers are nice quality though, just not a fan of the Roll Bar.
customer_reviews.author: SMF

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for flat feet
customer_reviews.text: I have to search high and low online for my husband's shoes, He wears a 14, has flat odd shaped feet, bunion or two and when I read reviews for this shoe, we decided to try it and all the reviews are correct. He loves the feel of this shoe, very comfortable. It is so difficult to find shoes that feel good and so glad we found these. If you have problem feet, this is a great shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Welty

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Have many New Balance shoes and this style runs very big. It even seems to be mismarked because it is more than 2 sizes bigger than any of the rest of my shoes. Attempted to exchange but the "30" day time window expired while I was out of the country on business. Tried to contact the company but they would not answer my email request. Only option now is to donate to a charity. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: 6E WIDTH made the diff for me
customer_reviews.text: After 3 days wear: 6E width is perfect for me and these shoes (11.5 size) fit me snugly but comfortably. I originally bought the New Balance 990v7 first in a 12 4E but too small so returned them. The 1540v2 is a little updated from the original 1540 I had about 5 years ago which were excellent shoes. Seems heavier on the sole but the increased amount of mesh means it is lighter on top. These are quite comfortable to wear all day but DO get a pair of replacement insoles...wide New Balance are great...the ones included with the shoes are worthless slivers. (to be updated)
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: You Have to Love This Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe from a great company. NB his a well deserved reputation for maklng excellent athletic shoes in all sizes and shapes. This includes true skillfully constructed product and much improved design. This is my choice of shoe and very rarely if ever wear another brand. My suggestion is that if you find a shoe that you love, buy a couple of them to ensure that you have some in reserve because they may be hard to find quickly. Thanks, sbh
customer_reviews.author: smile be happy

customer_reviews.title: My husband's favorite shoes
customer_reviews.text: My husband has insanely wide 6E feet (they are basically rectangles) and these are the best shoes he's ever had. He was still wearing the pair I bought him years ago and they were worn out. They have a version 3 but they weren't rated as well, so I was very excited to see that Amazon still has version 2. He is so happy, and so am I because it's difficult to find shoes that fit his feet and are also not insanely expensive.
customer_reviews.author: MrsIvey1018

customer_reviews.title: After heavy use I replaced them in 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: **71/2month Edit: I’m a big gal 200+ lbs and I’m on my feet 10hrs a day 4 days a week wearing them; They’ve Put their time in for A little over 6 months, but I had to retire them. The soul is starting to come apart from the shoe, the spot where the arch of your foot bends is particularly troubling and it just doesn’t cushion like it used to. ** Extremely comfortable. I wish I would’ve gotten them sooner. I have planters fasciitis and these combined with a pair of compression socks has all but eliminated my heel pain.
customer_reviews.author: Cesylie

customer_reviews.title: Just what I'd hoped for - pain relief from overpronation
customer_reviews.text: After months of sore feet and trials of both expensive custom orthotics and over the counter orthotics of several kinds I tried these shoes and in 72 hours my feet felt much better. Nothing else I'd tried countered the overpronation that was making the balls of my feet hurt so much. Of interest I tried the 9 wide in the women's version of this same model and it was too narrow, the toe box tight. The 9 wide in the men's fits better and has a wider toe box. VERY happy.
customer_reviews.author: Suzannah

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and quality by Merrell
customer_reviews.text: Although they did not have my particular size in the women's version of these shoes I purchased these in the men's size and love the way they fit. I normally wear a size 9 in women's and I purchased these and men size 7 and the wide version which worked out really well since I need to wear an orthotic in my shoes. I couldn't be happier with the shoes ...Merrell seems to be the best choice for my feet.
customer_reviews.author: DJM

customer_reviews.title: This is the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable shoe I have ever worn. I originally bought the white shoes but family made fun of me and I ended up buying this one. Same model just black, cause the stores do not have them in stock. The shoe fits great, and it feels like I am walking on air. I have flat feet and it is painful to walk in most shoes. This show is fantastic and I can walk all day in them! The price is incredibly high but I would do it again!
customer_reviews.author: KMan

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I love the rollbar shoes from New Balance and this shoe is their best. Very comfortable to wear and I don't feel as if I've been on my feet all day, even though I have. I recommend these shoes to anyone who needs a straight LAST shoe or has problems with Overpronation or Supination. Only issue with this shoe is the price, I know these were made in America, but come on man, $160 for a pair of shoes? Oh well, if you can afford them, get these shoes, they make you feel feel great!
customer_reviews.author: QykPick

customer_reviews.title: New Balance Running Shoe M1540NV2
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for my husband for Christmas. He put them on at about 7 a.m. as we left for a big day of visiting family. He did a good amount of walking, standing and some sitting thru out the day. My husband has a really wide foot, which is sometimes VERY difficult to fit. (Size 9 - 6E). When we finally got home, around 9:00 p.m., I asked the question that I had been asking throughout the day..... “How do your feel feel about your new shoes?” His reply was “They’re GREAT!” After a couple more days, I asked again, “How are the shoes?” His answer... “PERFECT!!!”
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Horney

customer_reviews.title: Good support
customer_reviews.text: I bought the shoes as a replacement for the New Balance 587's, which the company no longer makes. I've only had them for two weeks, but so far they seem to be fine. I did have to go one size wider to fit my orthotics. I did call the New Balance company, because Amazon shows two versions of the same model shoe - Blue and silver color, and this model which is black. The black ones also say something about maximum control. New Balance told me that both shoes are the same in every way but color.
customer_reviews.author: CB in AK

customer_reviews.title: M1540v2 for Heavy Man with Wide feet
customer_reviews.text: I am a heavy man that requires a wide tow box and rollover protection. New Balance has been the only sneaker that has met my knees in 20 plus years. This is my second purchase of this model and deferred my purchase and for a $50 off sales price.
customer_reviews.author: HRR

customer_reviews.title: Does what it said
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on the advice of my advisor/technician. I wear an AFO foot brace from my stroke. I got a new AFO and he told me about these shoes and how good they were in preventing ankle rollover. I ordered them and they arrived at the said time. I adjusted them to fit my AFO and they fit perfect. The rollbar technology in the heel really helped me with stability. They are a little pricey, but to me, they were well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Raney

customer_reviews.title: Stiff but otherwise a very good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a very good shoe. Fit is about perfect. One drawback for me is I feel the shoe is a bit too "stiff." It feels like I'm walking on a hard surface. I've worn these for several months, walk 5 miles a day in them. I'm 75. They're holding up very well but I prefer a softer, more cushioned feel under my feet, like the original NB 928, the Mother of All Shoes, IMO. The support is excellent. If you don't mind a stiff-feeling shoe, you might like these a lot. They're mesh, so cool, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R.

customer_reviews.title: Wears out too quickly.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best shoe I have found by far for someone who is: an over pronator, overweight and wears orthotic inserts. My only complaint is that the shoes lose their cushioning far too quickly. I have several pairs in use at any one time and rotate to a different pair every day. This supposedly allows the foam cushioning to rebound between wearings. But I still end up going through 4-5 pairs a year. It gets expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Man

customer_reviews.title: Although more expensive than the NB 990's I have used for several years this shoe is more durable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the comfort and the feel of these shoes They are much more durable and the rubber is much more resistant to damage when walking as I do every morning. I have an irregular stride on my left foot which tends to wear out the front toe structure. I have been walking with these shoes for some months now without any wear problems on my left foot. I do use arch support inserts as I have had plantar problems in the past. I like these shoes very much.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mullaney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fit and comfort, but limited durability
customer_reviews.text: Very cool, comfortable shoe. Although my foot size is a nominal 9.5 D, I buy New Balance in size 10 2E. Although it's labeled as a running shoe, I find it to be an excellent walking shoe. This is my second pair. My only complaint is that these shoes have soles of limited durability. After just four months of taking daily one- mile walks, the outer rubber covering had worn through on the outer edge of the heels. I'm still using the shoes nevertheless.
customer_reviews.author: Andybel

customer_reviews.title: They suck
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are awful. They weigh a ton. The soles are 1/4" to 3/4" wider than normal running shies. At the arch instead of getting narrow they are almost as wide as the toe. And because they are so wide they don't flex and make you run flat foot. It feels like the shoes from Seinfeld The Jimmy sold to George and Kramer. Don't buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Possible returns
customer_reviews.text: Great price been buying these for years best price I have ever seen. Shoes are great. reason for 2 stars is I believe these were returns and this was not stated in the add. They are suppose to com with two pairs of laces 1 black and 1 grey. Missing one of the black pair. Contents in box were were not packed like normal leading me to believe these were tried and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Cool shoes! I am well pleased, and because I have a really odd-sized foot (12 A or B), I have a difficult time finding shoes that fit properly. I recently came down with a case of plantar fasciitis on one foot, and these shoes were recommended to me to ease the pain. Well, these bad boys fit perfectly and are very comfortable. I am going to wear them for a few weeks, and if they continue to please me, I am going to order a second pair for general running around.
customer_reviews.author: Veganman

customer_reviews.title: Great sneakers.....very wide!
customer_reviews.text: These are great sneakers! I have very wide feet and often have a tough time finding shoes. But these are great to wear all day long. I have no pinch spots or overhang on the sides. I did after a couple months of wearing them, added some gel liners, just for a bit more comfort. They still had plenty of room in the shoe. I will buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: IcemaidenCT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I have big feet with high arches and finding good quality footwear has always been a problem, but these were recommended to me by a professional shoe store guy about 12 years ago and I've been wearing them ever since. The model number has changed a couple of times, and the colors have changed, but the quality and fit, form and function have always remained the same.
customer_reviews.author: Robert King

customer_reviews.title: Pronates badly.  Not a good replacement for the old M1540 model.
customer_reviews.text: Pronates badly. I purchased these to replace the previous model M1540, which was perfect for me but is no longer available. New Balance has a bad habit of discontinuing popular models and replacing them with something different, and in many cases, with poorer design. The old model M1540 had excellent protection against both pronation and supination. This new model M1540V2 has a different sole design, different toe box and no protection against pronation. In general, it's a longer and narrower shoe. I'll be going to the local New Balance store to find a better replacement than this for the old M1540.
customer_reviews.author: NickNC100

customer_reviews.title: A Little Pricey, But Worth It
customer_reviews.text: As I'm getting older, my feet are starting to hurt. Spent some time researching what shoe to purchase and found good reviews on this one. Love them so far. I with they had a little higher arch support, but overall they are nice and helping the pain in my feet subside.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I had developed tendinitis in one ankle. When I saw the orthopedic doctor I was wearing a different model of New Balance shoes and he recommended this model. I could tell these have better arch support than my original shoes. The good: Good arch support, decent ventilation, shoes come already laced up, Great quality made in the USA. Room for improvement: There are a bit pricy, but the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after a month
customer_reviews.text: When I first got these, they were very stiff. Stiff like metal in the soles stiff. I tried to work them in. The logos came off after 2 weeks of wearing. Then the shoelaces tore through the eyelets. I stopped wearing them when the soles separated from the top of the shoes. Waste of money. If I'm going to spend that much on shoes, I want them to last more than a month. Contacted New Balance, they refused to refund my money because I had worn them. Total ripoff and probably NOT made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Feet pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought them for my husband who had no issued with NB shoes all this while. This version is not for him, he kept complaining that these shoes made his feet pain. I sent email to NB customer service for recommendation to replace his previous version 770v4. The representative recommended 860v9 but haven't tried yet.
customer_reviews.author: hc

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cushioning And Arch Support - NOT For Plantar Fasciitis
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9.5 and this shoe was too long and wide. VERY hard heel with no cushion. I did not feel ANY arch support at all, which is very important for my feet. I am needing a supportive and cushioned shoe for plantar fasciitis and this shoe is not it. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: No*BoUnCe

customer_reviews.title: Been wearing for a little over a week, they feel good.
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the 847's, but after reading reviews, I decided to try this. I'm not a runner, but others expressed how they felt very comfortable. Keep in mind I've been wearing these for a little over a week only so far. The front near the toes is very roomy which is nice. So far they feel pretty durable. My 847's really were far gone so I had little to no arch support left, and with the new shoes, my feet hurt a *little* around the arches, but that's to be expected. They also came with an extra pair of laces (different color - grey) which was unexpected but nice.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuy

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by my podiatrist
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended for its stability and compatibility with orthotics. Very pleased with the fit, similar to other New Balance shoes I have had. Made in USA.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great Motion Control Running Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I need a motion control shoe because pronation will cause my knees to hurt without control. These have excellent motion control. With any running shoe, I have to use plastic heel taps on the outside edge of each heel (I get mine from Hale Heel Co.) because I am a hard heel striker and would wear down the heels too fast without the heel taps. But, with that caveat, these are great shoes for those who need pronation control.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Toe box far too wide for my foot
customer_reviews.text: Toe box far too wide for my foot, ordered one size larger than usual because toes touched in a previous model. Felt long enough initially with plenty of room between toe and front of shoe but after wearing a bit foot seems to move forward in shoe causing toe to touch again.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are pretty good for over-pronators, but do not offer the same level of arch support as something made expressly for that purpose (like a Brooks Beast 16 for example). However these do work well enough to be used as a daily driver for someone who walks a lot for a living or someone who enjoys long walks or leisurely jogs. The 1540v2 is also less equipped to deal with slipper surfaces, as I've slipped on them twice since buying them. A tiny bit narrow by a few millimeters.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Good fit.....Great Support
customer_reviews.text: I needed a shoe with an adequate toe box and support for my almost flat feet. These shoes seemed to hit all of my requirements. Plus they are a quality shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good for a walk, the gym and treadmill, not for street running.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe would be better advertised as a walking shoe. It is very heavy and has very bad arch support. I went running with them on and was forced to stop due to haw bad my left foot was feeling. I recommend another shoe, if you are running anymore than 1.5 miles, or on a treadmill.
customer_reviews.author: Hector J. Mariscal

customer_reviews.title: The battleship of running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I mostly walk and use the elliptical. I am not using these shoes for competition. I prioritize support. In fact, when finding these shoes, I specifically searched to find the sturdiest and heaviest running shoes available. I have owned many of the top brands - many more expensive. I like these the best. They are sturdy and heavy - which is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Toobusytofight

customer_reviews.title: Comfy shoes great for walking
customer_reviews.text: These are my husbands favorite shoes. He walks a lot and they are always comfortable. We do replace them about every six months but that is to be expected for any shoe that gets a lot off wear. He has very wide feet so the wide width is great for him. Whenever he gets a new pair, he gets a big smile on his face and says “ahhhh”.
customer_reviews.author: KG216

customer_reviews.title: Good Replacement for the old 587 model
customer_reviews.text: When my New Balance 587s wore out, I hoped to order another couple pairs. Sadly, they were discontinued so I had to find an American made New Balance that worked with my wide feet for jogging. This model fit the bill perfectly. I put approximately 10 miles on these and they are comfortable and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Cato

customer_reviews.title: Pronates badly.  Not a good replacement for the old M1540 model.
customer_reviews.text: Pronates badly. I purchased these to replace the previous model M1540, which was perfect for me but is no longer available. New Balance has a bad habit of discontinuing popular models and replacing them with something different, and in many cases, with poorer design. The old model M1540 had excellent protection against both pronation and supination. This new model M1540V2 has a different sole design, different toe box and no protection against pronation. In general, it's a longer and narrower shoe. I'll be going to the local New Balance store to find a better replacement than this for the old M1540.
customer_reviews.author: NickNC100

customer_reviews.title: Defective? Not wearable after only a few months!
customer_reviews.text: Shoes are unwearable after only light usage for less than 6 months. I want a replacement pair or refund-this is absurd for the cost of these sneakers!
customer_reviews.author: DADEF

customer_reviews.title: Inside lining fabric tears away.
customer_reviews.text: There is an inside lining of the sneaker that became separated from the inside padding about a month after purchase. Just outside the return period of course. But I can't run in them with the lining loose as it bunches up inside the sneaker. Will have to replace or put padding over it and for a shoe this price it shouldn't have happened.
customer_reviews.author: carss family

customer_reviews.title: Solid shoe for many uses
customer_reviews.text: I have fallen arches and need a shoe that can stand up to a fitness training environment. These do it. I don't do much running in them because I come down hard on my feet and the cushion isn't enough for me. I use 1260 V5's for that reason. The build on these is more solid than a lot of other NB shoes. I use these more as a cross trainer and the stability factor is outstanding. Walking in these would be great, even long distances. Some of my clients are heavy and use these shoes because they stand up to the demand.
customer_reviews.author: PVFocus

customer_reviews.title: Perfect shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these shord for years because they fit perfectly, are true to size, are extremely comfortable, and last longer than expected. I wear them a on oka daily basis and use then as walking shoes as opposed to running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Joel Mason

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: With my extra wide feet and developing hammer toe problems, it is difficult to find a good shoe to wear to the gym. These meet the bill. I ordered the 11 6E. I checked that these do not provide good arch support only because I need extra arch support for my orthopedic issues. However, these shoe do have the extra space for the insert necessary to provide extra arch support. I actually find these shoes so comfortable that I find myself reaching for them for daily wear and not just to the gym. They cost a little bit more, but they are well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. R. Hollowell

customer_reviews.title: Rheumatoid arthritis Millennial gal with stability issues
customer_reviews.text: I have rheumatoid arthritis, and my toes are clawed/hammer toes. My fat pat on the balls of my feet have deteriorated. I do wear custom orthotics, and have found these are the ONLY shoe I can wear. Since my feet swell during the day, I choose to wear the 4E width. I am on my feet all day. The motion control of these shoes keeps me stable. They are a heavy shoe, but I am very used to it. I also wear a mens shoe pin size 9.5. My women size is either a 10.5 or at times 11.
customer_reviews.author: tracina

customer_reviews.title: Walk a mile in my shoes ...
customer_reviews.text: ... you’ll be glad you did! I Love these shoes! My sixth pair in 2 years; I walk in these shoes at least 15 miles every week. So, count on the shoes for AT LEAST 250 miles per pair; more if your stride is true. (My stride is somewhat compromised because one leg is considerably weaker than the other). These shoes hold up better than any I have ever had in the past. And the arch support is magnificent.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Berney

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this brand before. I broke my foot a couple of years ago and needed better shoes to help support my feet. The doctor recommend these. I love these shoes. They have some weight to them and they keep my foot sturdy. Also they look like running shoes, and they are solid and protecting my feet!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shoe and the lowest price I could find anywhere
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shoe and the lowest price I could find anywhere. I am using it as a walking shoe as it is very similar to my previous pair which have been discontinued. Very comfortable and well worth the price .;
customer_reviews.author: David Crockett

customer_reviews.title: Size 12, 6E
customer_reviews.text: I have arthritic issues with feet, ankles, knees, etc. Have worn this shoe in a traditional width and was very pleased overall. Trying the Size 12, 6E width this time to allow for use of ankle sleeves, thicker socks, etc. The shoe is great and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: bgr

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are the most durable and comfortable shoes I have found for work and walking
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. These shoes are the most durable and comfortable shoes I have found for work and walking. They hold up well without breaking down for a my heavy weight, 240lbs. I am fairly actice, so these shoes take a beating.
customer_reviews.author: kjr

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 1540v3's. Perfect shoe for extreme overpronaters.
customer_reviews.text: If you are an overpronator (your feet stick out, i.e. you are "duck-footed") this is the perfect shoe for you. Their patented ROLLBAR technology corrects your movement, and this shoe provides perfect support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit?
customer_reviews.text: It is difficult to find shoes when you have size 15 extra wide feet. We were so happy to find these, and on sale!! However, the shoelaces were too short, so I had to spend an additional 9 dollars on shoelaces! Disappointing! Comeon, New Balance, you can do better than that!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Adair

customer_reviews.title: Big, Tall, Pronator? Get These
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy at 6'4" tall and 260 pounds. Even more challenging, perhaps, is that I pronate heavily. I was looking for a good shoe to get me running forward. At first, this shoe slipped a bit on the heal. I'm not exactly sure why. However, after about a week this stopped happening and they worked as other pairs I've purchased from New Balance. Now, some three months later, I'm still very satisfied with them.
customer_reviews.author: TopTenGamer

customer_reviews.title: If you back And knees hurt you this is what you need well worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: They feel great I would not have paid this price but got theses for my birthday from my wife!!! What a great surprise they feel great
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoes - I bought another pair!
customer_reviews.text: I had developed tendinitis in one ankle. When I saw the orthopedic doctor I was wearing a different model of New Balance shoes and he recommended this model. I could tell these have better arch support than my original shoes. The good: Good arch support, decent ventilation, shoes come already laced up, these came with two sets of laces (one black, one grey), Great quality made in the USA. Room for improvement: There are a bit pricy, but the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W.

customer_reviews.title: Rollbar feature helps with suplination (rolling feet/ankles outward)
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the rollbar tech seems to help with the suplination problem with my feet/ankles. The only real problem is the N wasn't attached all that well and started peeling off before I wore the shoes out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Deliver on Promise
customer_reviews.text: Weak ankles are no longer an issue. This is my fifth or sixth pair... why, beause they prevent ankle rolling and the related pain. It is rare for me now to have issues, they happen , but seem less severe. My only “pain point is the price... but they do work well for me.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Good shoes, good fit 11 4E
customer_reviews.text: We made a mistake and ordered the xwide and it wasn't wide enough. Now we are careful to make sure it says 4 E and it fits well on my husbands wide foot since he is recovering from ankle surgery. This is the shoe our doctor recommended. This one has the roll bar and its just what he needs for stability.
customer_reviews.author: Màrilyn Terra

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for walking
customer_reviews.text: My husband wore these all through our trip in Europe over the summer. Obviously, we did a ton of walking and he never once complained about shin splints or sore feet. He was disappointed that they were so dark (he has always worn white/gray New Balance), but these are the only made in the USA style walking/running shoes he could find by New Balance, his preferred brand.
customer_reviews.author: Momcat61

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and looks nice.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item as it seemed to have a wide front, which it did. It's also made in the USA, the reason it costs more than many of the New Balance products but I believe it's worth the extra money as the quality appears better than other New Balance shoes I presently have.
customer_reviews.author: Looker

customer_reviews.title: Treat Your Feet!!
customer_reviews.text: Wide feet, overweight, a combination to send screaming pain from sole to soul! My size 10.5 x 6E New Balance have been a physical salvation!! I’m working on my sixth pair (8 year wearer) They always fit, they always last and look good enough to wear anywhere- and I do wear them everywhere every day! (At age 73 I can do that) I long ago chucked the $$$$ podiatrist designed torture devises made to look like shoes. What can I say: the NB fit, wear well, they’re comfortable and worth the $. Get a pair? You’ll like’em.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Width selection is incorrect
customer_reviews.text: The 1540v2 is a nice shoe that helps keep my feet stable. I needed a replacement pair and ordered them here. According to New Balance and the seller XW is 4E, which I need. I ordered XW and received 2E. I returned them thinking they shipped the wrong shoes. I reordered the XW which was currently on sale. The email confirmation said XW 2E which will not work. I had to cancel that order and will source from somewhere else. I do not want to order the XXW and find they are 6E, as New Balance and the seller state, and then I will have to return those. If you get the right size, they are great shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A.

customer_reviews.title: The best shoes on the market for support
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has the Maxium support to any show new balance makes. It is a great fit and support to any thing else. If you don’t think so wear the shoe for about 2 weeks then put on something else you will see how much this shoe is superior to any other shoe for Maxium support for pronation and supronators. Your having feet pain? Buy this shoe it will help. I own 4 pairs
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: New Balance 6E fits perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when promised. The fit is perfect. I wore them all day and didn’t even have to break them in. So happy with New Balance because they are the only athletic shoe with a true 6E width.
customer_reviews.author: Elliott S Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Fine walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have ordinary feet, not too narrow nor wide but I need a snug fit for ankle support. Some shoes like these are too roomy and I have to tie them too tight. I normally wear a 10D and this fits just right. I needed something for walking on a Europe trip and the comfort of this shoe is very good. So - if you have big or wide feet order accordingly. If you want a snug fit this is for you. If you like your shoes roomier - order a bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob W.

customer_reviews.title: but initial impressions are good. It feels like a very well made shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have only had these shoes for a few days, but initial impressions are good. It feels like a very well made shoe, and was pretty comfortable right out of the box. So far I have only wore them on an indoor treadmill. I purchased them for walking as I have recently had some foot pain that I think might be plantar fasciitis.
customer_reviews.author: rodelco

customer_reviews.title: Only shoe for me
customer_reviews.text: All I wear at work and at home. I’m a big guy with big feet and they are omfortable . Fit very well. They are less comfortable after 3 years or so and were recently retired and replaced. I will continue to buy this shoe as long as they make them.
customer_reviews.author: Dntpokedbear

customer_reviews.title: Best New Balance ever!
customer_reviews.text: Every year my husband and I purchase New Balance 1540 or the newest high number. This is our 5th year. We LOVE them. They fit like a dream and are true every time. I have referred these to so many people who have purchased them. I even spoke to my Orthopedic physician. He refers them to his patients now. You should have a loyalty program! These are great shoes and are also a real foot saver. 🙌🎉😀
customer_reviews.author: Cathy DiZi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I have to wear a brace on my leg and needed a solid shoe to support me / it. This shoe is excellent for it. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit great ... not much arch support but appear to be made well. At this price I wanted more but may buy them again as I have had trouble getting a pair of shoes on-line that fit.
customer_reviews.author: chesskix

customer_reviews.title: Used shoes sold as new!
customer_reviews.text: Not thrilled that shoes are clearly used, dirt on the bottom of one of them and the base of the shoe is worn from someone trying to scrub it clean to present it as new.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Lauf

customer_reviews.title: Great walking and running shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great walking and running shoe! Very comfortable on long walks. I also play tennis with these! Roomy, soft, well cushioned, good for my knees. I had a knee problem, but after playing tennis with these shoes for a month or two, my knee problem went away! No complaint!
customer_reviews.author: Vlad Bril

customer_reviews.title: Ordered 4E - received 2E makes difference
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes - sadly seller sent 2E and not the 4E I ordered ( waiting to hear from seller ) I’ll post on how this works out. BTW - they’re great shoes ( little pricy) but if right size you’ll love them !
customer_reviews.author: Dr Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Fits really well, feels premium and it’s great to support American workers in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Sam

customer_reviews.title: No where near as good as the 1540v1.
customer_reviews.text: I have a deformed right foot due to a cortozone induced injury. The NB 1011 and the 1540v1 could accommodate the deformity better than any other shoe. NB always takes their good products off line so I had no other choice but to buy the 1540v2.
customer_reviews.author: Shoeless TM

customer_reviews.title: Not what to expect from New Balance shoes for the price
customer_reviews.text: The gray trim on the shoes keeps coming loose and I have had to glue them several times. I currently have 9 pair of New Balance shoes and have never seen anything like these especially for what they cost. I sent an email to New Balance and there response was to go back to where I purchased them.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best Price Available
customer_reviews.text: This model was recommended by podiatrist after my husband saw him about a limp. We buy a new pair every 9-10 months and always price shop, ending up buying on Amazon. These offer great support for his feet and have relieved the limp.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Primers

customer_reviews.title: Good show for Foot Issues
customer_reviews.text: Good toe box but loose in heel. Letter N fell off in short time on one side. Try sizes to fit best . Long time wearer of New Balance. Wish they’d bring back 1012 model
customer_reviews.author: C. Dignan

customer_reviews.title: I love these
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great for me for exercising. It helps with flatter feet and with wider feet. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The shies had been worn before. Not outside, ...
customer_reviews.text: The shies had been worn before. Not outside, but enough inside wear that I notice it. The laces didn't match, but the extra laces are in the box. A light grey pair and a black pair. The tissue in the box was disheveled. I don't think they should have been full price if they were used. I have clown feet. Flat, really wide. NB is the only company who makes the appropriate width for me.
customer_reviews.author: artislife

customer_reviews.title: Stable shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have used this model New Balance before and find it very stable in the "foot plant" while running. I have experimented in the widths as it accomodates orthodics insoles, so look for a little wider size, using this shoe. It also has light weight mesh on toe box, if you have problems with hammer toes. Price good, Stable shoe, Made in USA, will continue to purchace in future.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo DD

customer_reviews.title: Clunky shoe with a very hard sole.
customer_reviews.text: I've been where NB running shoes for over 35 years and this was so disappointing that I returned them. The sole is very hard and has a weird contour on the heal that bothered me when walking around in them. I can't imagine what they would feel like if I ran in them. Very stiff and clunky. I decided to purchase the 860s instead.
customer_reviews.author: John Murakami

customer_reviews.title: Motion control shoes for Foot-over pronation (ankles that turn in)
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a shoe that corrects my walking problems. Always have been told by varies podiatrist that arch supports would resolve my problems. It's not the arch it's the ankles are turned in require a specially shoe. This is called Foot-over pronation and these shoes help correct this problem with these motion control shoes. Thanks for solving my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Deutsch

customer_reviews.title: Great support for my aging knees and falling arches
customer_reviews.text: These shoes offer excellent support. A shoe specialist fitted me for them and I never would have figured out my true size, but what an improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Janis M.

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you dont need cushioning
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is exclusively for those needing lateral support and dont need cushioning. The shoe is not for walkers or anyone on their feet for any extended period.
customer_reviews.author: K Johnson

customer_reviews.title: They're Ok
customer_reviews.text: Usually New Balance works well for my flat, bunion plagued feet. In this case, not so well as I'd hoped. For some reason my feet, especially the right one, hurt when I exercise. This was the same case for the Nike's I had before this though and it may not be the shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Sephethus

product_meta.title: New Balance - Mens M1540V2 Running Shoes, 10.5 UK - Width B, Navy/Grey
product_meta.description:
The Made-in-USA New Balance 1540v2 delivers maximum support in a modern profile. With symmetrical ROLLBAR® technology for premium lateral and medial rear foot stability and a synthetic mesh upper for structure and breathability, this shoe is made for both supinators and over-pronators. Colors: Silver + Blue

NOTE: This shoe runs a little short. Consider ordering a half size up.
feature_bullets: No sew manmade and fabric mesh upper with logo detail for added appeal
Lace up closure for a secure fit with a padded tongue and dual density foam collar for added support
Fabric mesh lining with a removable cushioned footbed for added comfort
Acteva Lite foam midsole with ENCAP technology for added support
Rollbar system helps reduce rear foot movement
